intro: Rondeletia trichotoma, commonly known as the velvetleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas.
